text: Could HubSpot please add examples of using variables when passing data to module to the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules/using-modules-in-templates|Using Modules in Templates documentation>? It is far from obvious that if I have data in a list (`pprint` show `PyList`) I need to pass it like a `{% module "foo" path="../modules/foo" repeater_param="{{ the_variable_holding_the_pylist }}" %}`  The documentation only mentions that variables can be used in the _Passing dicts to module parameters_ section but does not show how.
Especially when setting `repeater_param=[the_variable_holding_the_pylist]` does pass the data otherwise as expected but obviously wrapped in a list

Creating a new module with only the HubL Tag
```{% related_blog_posts %} ```
throws an error:
`Cannot resolve property "[missing {{token}} value]"`

Replicated on our own portal and a customers portal

Hi All,
Can anybody tell me that <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-functions#blog-recent-author-posts|blog_recent_author_posts> this function is working or not?
can anyone point me in the right direction for a list of contact and company properties available within a HUBL/HTML template? I can't seem to find this list anywhere in the docs
E.g `contact.firstname` or `company.name`. would just like to see a list of what's available to use within the personalization realm of HubSpot
try just printing `{{ contact }}` and see all that prints out
appreciate the quick trick here, but I'm trying to get this list to some marketing ops teammates so they can see what's available.

I don't know of a comprehensive designed list or anything, but it's every contact property in the CRM, so it's going to vary portal to portal. Could always see them by going to settings > properties I suppose
